definition: to make/to cause/to enable/to use/to employ/to send/to instruct sb to do sth/envoy/messenger

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: They will become the "torch carriers" for China-ASEAN friendship.
sentences.chinese: 他们将成为中国和东盟友谊薪火相传的光明使者。

sentences.english: And that is why I think his envoys cannot succeed.
sentences.chinese: 这就是为什么他的使者不能成功。

sentences.english: The sky was dark on the evening that the Tyrant's emissaries came to Tegea.
sentences.chinese: 在叙拉古的使者来到忒格亚的那天晚上天色很黑。

sentences.english: I Jesus have sent mine angel to testify unto you these things in the churches.
sentences.chinese: 我耶稣差遣我的使者为众教会将这些事向你们证明。

sentences.english: The Olympic Games are a messenger of universal peace and competition in sports.
sentences.chinese: 奥运是世界和平与体育竞技的使者。

sentences.english: This is the first time we have provided information to AFC .
sentences.chinese: 这是本会首次提供资讯给使者。

sentences.english: The two angels came to Sodom at evening.
sentences.chinese: 黄昏时，那两位使者来到了索多玛。

sentences.english: But God was very angry when he went, and the angel of the Lord stood in the road to oppose him.
sentences.chinese: 神因他去就发了怒，耶和华的使者站在路上敌挡他。

sentences.english: He is the clever evil spirit messenger, is pretends the bright messenger to arrive in this world.
sentences.chinese: 他是鬼魔的差役，是装作光明的使者来到这世上的。

sentences.english: And they sent also to the king of Moab, but he would not consent.
sentences.chinese: 又照样打发使者去见摩押王，他也不允准。

sentences.english: Let them be as chaff before the wind: and let the angel of the LORD chase them.
sentences.chinese: 愿他们像风前的糠，有耶和华的使者赶逐他们。

sentences.english: A floriculturist ancient times, this is health food hero.
sentences.chinese: 古有护花使者，今有卫菜英雄。

sentences.english: Then at the place where I saw the angel of the Lord, I built a altar.
sentences.chinese: 随后，在那个主的使者出现的地方，我立了一座坛。

sentences.english: Hung Chao and the " emissaries s " from the design of such information .
sentences.chinese: 洪潮和“使者拧”，从这些资料的设计。

sentences.english: And David sent messengers to comfort him concerning his father. So the servants of David came into the land of the children of Ammon to Hanun, to comfort him.
sentences.chinese: 于是大卫差遣使者为他丧父安慰他。

definition: to go abroad as ambassador/to be sent on a diplomatic mission
to have an audience (with the Emperor)
credentials (of a diplomat)/documents exchanged between nations/national or dynastic history book
to offer (tribute)/to present respectfully (to superior, ancestor, deity etc)/to esteem/to revere/to believe in (a religion)/to wait upon/to accept orders (from superior)
to have an audience (with the Emperor)
call in (one's subordinates)/summon (an envoy of a foreign country) to an interview
